arm_group.description: daily or twice-a-day administration of transcranial Direct Current Stimulation

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether transcranial direct current stimulation
      (tDCS) is effective in the treatment of psychiatric disorders in which available treatments
      are either ineffective or not tolerated

clinical_study.brief_title: Non-invasive Brain Stimulation for the Treatment of Psychiatric Disorders

detailed_description.textblock:
Depending on the specific psychiatric disorder, inhibitory or stimulating neuromodulation
      will be applied over the cortical region of interest, found according to the relevant
      scientific publication on neurophysiology of psychiatric disorders

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  a psychiatric disorder in which available treatment are either ineffective or not
             tolerated

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  implantable active devices

intervention.description: daily or twice-a-day administration of transcranial Direct Current Stimulation from a minimum of 10 session to a maximum of 20

clinical_study.official_title: Non-invasive Brain Stimulation for the Treatment of Psychiatric Disorders

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Psychiatric rating scales scores at immediate post-treatment and at one-month and at three-month follow-up visits
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time points: T0=baseline; T1=immediate post-treatment; T2=one-month follow-up visit; T3=3-months follow-up visit

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
